extendedIngredients.name: leeks
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2 cups chopped leeks (white and pale green parts only; from 2 medium)

title: Celery Bisque with Stilton Toasts
summary: Celery Bisque with Stilton Toasts might be just the soup you are searching for. This recipe serves 4 and costs $1.82 per serving. Watching your figure? This gluten free and vegetarian recipe has 236 calories, 9g of protein, and 14g of fat per serving. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. If you have butter, low-salt chicken broth, celery, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 47%, this dish is solid. Try Celery, Ham and Cheese Toasts, Celery and Pear Bisque, and Celery Root Bisque for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Melt butter in heavy large pot over medium-high heat. Add celery and leeks. Sauté until celery is slightly softened, about 4 minutes. Add potatoes and 4 cups broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, uncovered, until all vegetables are tender, about 30 minutes. Working in batches, puree soup in blender until smooth. Return to same pot. Whisk in 1/3 cup crème fraîche and cayenne pepper. Season soup to taste with salt and pepper. (Can be prepared 2 days ahead. Cool, then cover and refrigerate. Rewarm over medium heat before serving, adding more broth to thin if desired.)                                                                Ladle soup into bowls. Swirl 1 to 2 teaspoons additional crème fraîche into each. Sprinkle with parsley, if desired. Serve with Stilton Toasts.

steps.step: Melt butter in heavy large pot over medium-high heat.
Add celery and leeks. Sauté until celery is slightly softened, about 4 minutes.

Add potatoes and 4 cups broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, uncovered, until all vegetables are tender, about 30 minutes. Working in batches, puree soup in blender until smooth. Return to same pot.

Whisk in 1/3 cup crème fraîche and cayenne pepper. Season soup to taste with salt and pepper. (Can be prepared 2 days ahead. Cool, then cover and refrigerate. Rewarm over medium heat before serving, adding more broth to thin if desired.)
Ladle soup into bowls. Swirl 1 to 2 teaspoons additional crème fraîche into each.
